derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English(denoting a ball or finial at the top point of a tower, corner of an altar, etc.): from Old French pomel, from a diminutive of Latin pomum 'fruit, apple'

entry.def: A pommel is the part of a saddle that rises up at the front, or a knob that is fixed there.

means.word_mean: 1. a handgrip that a gymnast uses when performing exercises on a pommel horse
2. handgrip formed by the raised front part of a saddle
3. an ornament in the shape of a ball on the hilt of a sword or dagger
